did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Juan Navarrete y Guerrero collection, 1912-2000
did.abstract: Papers, 1912-2000 (bulk 1948-2000). This collection contains materials relating to Bishop Juan Navarrete y Guerrero of the diocese of Hermosillo, Sonora. Items include biographical materials; printed materials including newsletters and pamphlets; audio materials; and photographic materials including photographs, slides, and postcards. The bulk of the material is a nearly complete set of the El Católico newsletter (1948-2000) and over thirty of Navarrete y Guerrero's recorded sermons. All materials are in Spanish.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Juan Navarrete y Guerrero collection (MS 423). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Juan Navarrete y Guerrero was born in 1886 in Oaxaca, Mexico. He began his studies at the Seminary Church of León, Guanajuato. In 1904 he traveled to Rome to continue his studies at the Colegio Pío Latino Americano de Roma. He earned his doctorate of theology in 1909 from the Pontificia Universidad Gregoriana. That same year he returned to Aguascalientes, Mexico an ordained priest. In 1916 he founded various Catholic organizations including the Acción Católica de la Juventud Mexicana (A.C.J.M.) which was later active in the Cristero Movement. In 1919 he was ordained bishop of Sonora at only 32 years of age, becoming the world's youngest bishop.

In 1926 Navarrete y Guerrero was exiled to Arizona as a result of the anti-Catholic persecution implemented by President Plutarco Calles. During this time he became involved in the Cristero Movement which was a rebellion against the anti-Catholic stance of the Mexican government. Navarrete y Guerrero returned to Sonora in 1929 but three years later, in 1932, a warrant was issued for his arrest and he was subsequently exiled again for five years. In 1937 he returned to Sonora after the new governor granted him amnesty.

Upon his return to the Sonoran Diocese, he began to help rebuild the Catholic community that had suffered during the Cristero Movement. Throughout the 1940s to the 1960s he was instrumental in founding hospitals, orphanages, and over fifty Catholic schools. In 1959 the Diocese of Sonora was divided in two: the Diocese of Hermosillo and the Diocese of Cuidad Obregón and in 1964, Navarrete y Guerrero was appointed the first archbishop of Hermosillo. He retired four years later and was soon after appointed Titular Archbishop of Vulturaria. He died in February of 1982, at the age of ninety-five.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 6 series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1912-2000 (bulk 1948-2000). This collection contains materials relating to Bishop Juan Navarrete y Guerrero of the diocese of Hermosillo, Sonora. Materials include; Navarrete y Guerrero biographies, community histories of the Sonoran Diocese, a nearly complete set of the El Católico newsletter (1948-2000), over thirty of Navarrete y Guerrero's recorded sermons, recordings of religious songs, as well as recorded sermons and lectures by others, photographs of Navarrete y Guerrero and members of the Sonoran Diocese including the El Católico staff, and slide sets of La Tierra Santa (The Holy Land) and the Vatican. All materials are in Spanish.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: de la Torre Family Papers, (1874-1994), MS 420

item.corpname: Catholic Church. Diocese of Sonora -- History.

did.unittitle: Biographical Files. 1964-1969

scopecontent.p: Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains biographical information on Juan Navarrete y Guerrero. One biography also includes a brief history of the Sonoran Diocese. All materials in this series are in Spanish.

did.unittitle: Navarrete y Guerrero, Juan History – El Semenario Perseguido 1932-1937. undated
Navarrete y Guerrero, Juan History (album recuerdo) – Juan Navarrete y Guerrero. 1964
Navarrete y Guerrero, Juan and Sonoran Diocese History – Esfuerzo. 1969
Subject Files. 1936-1969

scopecontent.p: Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains a handwritten newsletter, El Gran Cues., from 1936, an incomplete set of martyr cards relating the biographical and historical information of Mexican martyrs mostly from the 1920's and 30's, and two documents regarding the community of Sonora: Sonora a su Reina y Madre, an "album recuerdo" pertaining to the history of the Diocese of Sonora and Distinguidas personas desaparecidas de la vida sonorense which contains brief biographical information on notable deceased citizens of Hermosillo, Sonora. All Subject Files materials are in Spanish.

did.unittitle: El Gran Cues. Periódico Semenal. 1936
Mexican Martyrs. undated
Sonora Community History. 1938-1969
Printed Materials. 1948-2000

scopecontent.p: Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains newsletters and pamphlets. The bulk of the series is a nearly complete set of the religious newsletter, El Católico, published by the Diocese of Hermosillo, Sonora. The remainder of the series consists of three religious pamphlets. All Printed Materials are in Spanish. Note: Some materials are located in Series VI: Oversize Materials.

Photographic Materials. 1912-1977

scopecontent.p: Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains photographs of Navarrete y Guerrero and photographs of members of the Sonoran Diocese including the El Católico staff. Also included are two travel souvenir slide collections of La Tierra Santa (the Holy Land) and the Vatican. Among the postcards is a marked postcard with the writing of Navarrete y Guerrero. The text within this series is in Spanish.

did.unittitle: Photographs – General. 1912-1977
Photographs – Navarrete y Guerrero, Juan. undated, 1963-1970
Postcards. undated, 1964
Slides - La Tierra Santa. undated
Slides – Souvenirs of the Vatican. undated
Audio Materials. 1948-1994

scopecontent.p: This series contains over thirty of Juan Navarrete y Guerrero's sermons (1948-1960). The original copies, recorded on cassette tapes, will be transferred to CD format for public use. Other audio materials include religious songs as well as other speakers' sermons and lectures. The tapes not transferred to CD, located in Box 6, have been arranged alphabetically by title. All audio materials are in Spanish.

scopecontent.p: This series contains an oversize item from the Printed Materials series: En Marcha, a religious newsletter from Hermosillo, Sonora. All materials are in Spanish.
